snippet: The state schools superintendent, Glenda Ritz, acknowledged manipulation in the way Indiana’s schools are graded, the latest fallout from a report by The Associated Press.
abstract: Indiana schools superintendent Glenda Ritz acknowledges manipulation in the way state's schools are graded, latest fallout from The Associated Press report that found her predecessor worked behind the scenes to improve the score of a charter school founded by an influential Republican donor.
lead_paragraph: The state schools superintendent, Glenda Ritz, acknowledged manipulation in the way Indiana’s schools are graded, the latest fallout from a report by The Associated Press.
